Thanks to all those who participated in shaping the Senchi Consensus.
The National Economic Forum in Senchi brought Ghanaians from diverse backgrounds together to reach a consensus on the way forward.
We have been proactive in implementing some of the consensus reached in Senchi whilst we were waiting for the final report.

The budget for the Academy of Mayan Languages ​​in Guatemala (ALMG) will be strengthened for 2015 with an increase of Q6 million.
We wish to support the continuity of teaching and promotion programs of the 22 Mayan languages ​​as well as the programming of the Tv Maya channel.
It is important that the Mayan languages ​​do not disappear but that they transcend as representatives of our history and culture.

Photo gallery: official visit to Washington to address migration issues. https://t.co/N6iSdQ2Yg5
To solve the migration issue in the US, I propose to generate a "comprehensive plan" for Central America, covering three priority axes.
The plan must include aspects of security, economy and social development, with a financing of at least 2,000 million dollars.
Migration issues should be comprehensive and not seen in isolation, since all countries have responsibilities.
We must see the project as an investment, migration issues are a humanitarian problem, especially the treatment of children.
Today's meeting with the representatives of the US Congress, was positive we addressed issues of interest to our country.
With the presidents of El Salvador and Honduras we will present alternatives tomorrow to avoid the increase of immigrants to the US.
We have to be strong in every area. Today Turkey; Ukraine, Egypt, Syria, if not like the services we have done in the last 12 years.
